newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hong Kong's Yam says sees no change in HK$/US$ peg.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong's Yam says sees no change in HK$/US$ peg.

text.p: Joseph Yam, Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, said on Tuesday that he did not foresee a change in its policy concerning the pegging of the Hong Kong dollar to the U.S. dollar.
He was speaking at a seminar on Hong Kong monetary arrangements after 1997 in Tokyo.

Asked how long Hong Kong planned to maintain its peg to the U.S. dollar and under what circumstances it would change the current system, he said: "I do not foresee any change in policy." maintain the Hong Kong's dollar's stability against other international currencies.
The Hong Kong dollar is currently pegged at an exchange rate of 7.80 to the U.S. dollar.
The HKMA is the territory"s de-facto central bank.
